vscontrolcraft.ponder.basic_0.text.0: Every component has input ports or output ports
vscontrolcraft.ponder.basic_0.text.1: Every component has input ports or output ports
vscontrolcraft.ponder.basic_1.text.0: An output port can link to multiple input ports
vscontrolcraft.ponder.basic_1.text.1: But an input port can only link to one output port
vscontrolcraft.ponder.basic_2.text.4: Combinational Components are components that do not have any internal state
vscontrolcraft.ponder.basic_2.text.5: They Transmits Signals Without Any Delay
vscontrolcraft.ponder.basic_2.text.7: They takes time to transit between states
vscontrolcraft.ponder.basic_2.text.8: The delay is decided by specific settings
vscontrolcraft.ponder.basic_3.text.1: A loop must contain at least 1 temporal component
vscontrolcraft.ponder.basic_3.text.2: This is still a valid loop
vscontrolcraft.ponder.basic_3.text.3: This is not a valid loop
vscontrolcraft.ponder.circuit_0.text.2: Compiler is design for this case
vscontrolcraft.ponder.circuit_0.text.4: select an area to include circuit
vscontrolcraft.ponder.circuit_0.text.6: Now you get a compiler, which stores the circuit
vscontrolcraft.ponder.circuit_0.text.8: Click with compiler you just got
vscontrolcraft.ponder.circuit_0.text.9: Now it copies the circuit you just store
vscontrolcraft.ponder.circuit_0.text.10: Input Link Port blocks of the original circuit
vscontrolcraft.ponder.circuit_0.text.11: Is converted to circuit block's input ports
vscontrolcraft.ponder.circuit_0.text.12: Output Link Port blocks of the original circuit
vscontrolcraft.ponder.circuit_0.text.13: Is converted to circuit block's output ports
vscontrolcraft.ponder.circuit_1.text.0: Compiled Circuit Can Be Further Compiled.
vscontrolcraft.ponder.circuit_1.text.1: This circuit behaves just the same as the original one
vscontrolcraft.ponder.cmp.text.4: The result is its three outputs
vscontrolcraft.ponder.cmp.text.8: i0(4) > i1(2), Ge = true, other = false
vscontrolcraft.ponder.cmp.text.9: i0(2) < i1(4), Le = true, other = false
vscontrolcraft.ponder.ff_0.text.1: It Flips its input every tick, with 1 tick delay
vscontrolcraft.ponder.ff_0.text.7: It transmits its input with 1 tick delay
vscontrolcraft.ponder.ff_1.text.0: This is an Async T-Flip-Flop, It Has a clk input
vscontrolcraft.ponder.ff_1.text.3: Only When clk is change from False to True, i.e. an positive edge
vscontrolcraft.ponder.ff_1.text.12: TFF flip its input and get output 1.0(True)
vscontrolcraft.ponder.ff_1.text.15: TFF flip its input and get output 0.0(False)
vscontrolcraft.ponder.ff_1.text.16: This is an Async D-Flip-Flop, It Has a clk input
vscontrolcraft.ponder.ff_1.text.17: Only When clk is change from False to True, i.e. an positive edge
vscontrolcraft.ponder.ff_1.text.26: DFF transmit its input and get output 1.0(True)
vscontrolcraft.ponder.ff_1.text.29: DFF transmit its input and get output 0.0(False)
vscontrolcraft.ponder.fma.text.1: It multiply its input with coefficients
vscontrolcraft.ponder.gates.text.1: Any value > 0.5 is consider a "True" input
vscontrolcraft.ponder.gates.text.2: Otherwise it is consider a "False" input
vscontrolcraft.ponder.gates.text.3: Gates output is always either 1.0 or 0.0
vscontrolcraft.ponder.gates.text.17: AND Gate Only Output True(1.0) when Both Input are True(>0.5)
vscontrolcraft.ponder.gates.text.31: OR Gate Only Output False(0.0) when Both Input are False(<0.5)
vscontrolcraft.ponder.gates.text.45: XOR Gate Only Output True(1.0) when Only 1 Input are True(>0.5)
vscontrolcraft.ponder.imu.text.1: You can get velocity/omega/.. values of the vs ship its located on
vscontrolcraft.ponder.io.text.0: Input port accepts surrounding redstone input
vscontrolcraft.ponder.io.text.1: Output port applies redstone output to surrounding blocks
vscontrolcraft.ponder.io.text.2: You can also manually set values to input port from its ui
vscontrolcraft.ponder.mux.text.1: It selects one of its inputs based on a selector
vscontrolcraft.ponder.mux.text.2: If selector is False, it outputs i0
vscontrolcraft.ponder.mux.text.3: If selector is True, it outputs i1
vscontrolcraft.ponder.proxy.text.1: It is used to expose machine input and output ports
vscontrolcraft.ponder.proxy.text.2: Let's say it's attached to a speed controller
vscontrolcraft.ponder.proxy.text.3: You can now set speed and get speed from proxy ports
vscontrolcraft.ponder.proxy.text.7: For resistor, you can get and set RATIO in proxy port
vscontrolcraft.ponder.proxy.text.8: For propeller, you can get and set SPEED in proxy port
vscontrolcraft.ponder.proxy.text.9: For cannons, you can get PITCH and YAW in proxy port
vscontrolcraft.ponder.proxy.text.10: For tweaked lectern controller, you can get player INPUT AXIS in proxy port
vscontrolcraft.ponder.proxy.text.11: Just try it yourself to see what you can get/set!
vscontrolcraft.ponder.shifter_0.text.1: It shifts its input by DELAY tick, which is configurable in its ui
vscontrolcraft.ponder.shifter_1.text.2: when a positive edge is received at clk port
